top_categories.workout_context: Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder’s nevada desert, local event demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder. Make this intensity feel like home.
Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder’s nevada desert gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Racing Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The varied gradients at Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder’s nevada desert gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Every session at Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder’s 3,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Beaver Dam Gravel Grinder requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on nevada desert gravel to build confidence. Expect: nevada desert, local event, mountain west gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 50 miles of nevada desert gravel in Beaver Dam State Park, Nevada.
